article.headline: Utah Valley St. 89, N.J. Tech 39
article.story: OREM, Utah -- Josh Olsen scored a game-high 21 points to lead Utah Valley to an 89-39 win over New Jersey Institute of Technology Saturday night. The 50-point loss was the worst of the season for NJIT (1-28), which has now dropped 10 consecutive contests. The Wolverines' leading scorer, Ryan Toolson, was held to four points in the first half, but his first basket with 9:11 remaining in the opening half capped a 17-2 run that gave UVU a 23-6 lead. Olsen's 3-pointer at the halftime buzzer handed the Wolverines a 43-18 advantage. UVU (16-11) shot 59 percent from the field for the game and was 16-of-26 from behind the 3-point arc. Tyray Petty scored 15 while Jourdain Scoubes and Ryan Toolson both scored 14 for the Wolverines. The Highlanders, shooting 33 percent, were led by Gary Garris 11 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
